Package renderer

Class Render

java.lang.Object
renderer.Render
public class Render
extends java.lang.Object
Render class which responsible of creating the color matrix of the scene

    this function cheak which point value of the geo point is the closest to the camera (refactoring- now we get geo point and return geo point instead of regular point)
    void printGrid​(int interval, java.awt.Color color)
    this function print the grid of the image
    void renderImage()
    this function create the image pixel after pixel (refactoring- now when we create the image, were going on a list of geo points) (refactoring- now we use the findCLosestIntersection function instead of closest point)

  • Method Details

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      this function create the image pixel after pixel (refactoring- now when we create the image, were going on a list of geo points) (refactoring- now we use the findCLosestIntersection function instead of closest point)

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geop, Ray inray)
      this function is a wrapping function for the calcColor this function gets two arguments and send to the calcColor with 4 arguments
      Parameters:
      geop - the geo point that sets the color of the pixel to the calculation
      inray - the ray that constructed from the camera and intersected the geometry
      Returns:
      the color of the point for calculating the color for the pixel

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint p, Ray ray, int level, double k)
      this function calculate the color of a point from calculating the color of the pixel (refactoring- now we get geo point instead of regular point) (refactoring- we add the shadow, reflection and the refraction influences)
      Parameters:
      p - the geo point that sets the color of the pixel to the calculation
      ray - the ray that constructed from the camera and intersected the geometry
      level - the level of the recursion
      k - comparison measure for the recursion
      Returns:
      the color of the point for calculating the color for the pixel

    • sign

      private boolean sign​(double val)
      this function returns rather the given parameter is positive
      Parameters:
      val - double parameter
      Returns:
      rather the given parameter is positive

    • calcDiffusive

      private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, double nl, Color ip)
      a helper method for calculating the diffusive color
      Parameters:
      kd - material attenuation coefficient
      nl - vector represents scalar product between the vector from the light source and the normal
      ip - the color calculated without the diffusive
      Returns:
      the color caused by the diffusive influence

    • calcSpecular

      private Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, double nl, Vector v, int nShininess, Color ip)
      a helper method for calculating the specular color
      Parameters:
      ks - material attenuation coefficient
      l - the vector from the light source
      n - the normal vector to the intersected point
      nl - vector represents scalar product between the vector from the light source and the normal
      v - vector construct from the camera to the intersected point
      nShininess - glitter coefficient of the material
      ip - the color calculated without the specular
      Returns:
      the color caused by the specular influence

    • constructRefractedRay

      private Ray constructRefractedRay​(Point3D pointGeo, Ray inRay, Vector n)
      this function construct a refraction ray from the ray intersected withe the geometry
      Parameters:
      pointGeo - the intersected point
      inRay - the vector from the light source
      n - the normal vector to the intersected point
      Returns:
      refraction vector

    • constructReflectedRay

      private Ray constructReflectedRay​(Point3D pointGeo, Ray inRay, Vector n)
      this function construct a reflection ray from the ray intersected withe the geometry
      Parameters:
      pointGeo - the intersected point
      inRay - the vector from the light source
      n - the normal vector to the intersected point
      Returns:
      reflection vector

    • transparency

      private double transparency​(LightSource ls, Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint gp)
      this function calculate the influence of shadows
      Parameters:
      ls - the light source that illuminates the geometry
      l - the vector from the light source
      n - the normal vector to the intersected point
      gp - the intersected point
      Returns:
      the level of the transparent influence on the objects

    • getClosestPoint

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint getClosestPoint​(java.util.List<Intersectable.GeoPoint> points)
      this function cheak which point value of the geo point is the closest to the camera (refactoring- now we get geo point and return geo point instead of regular point)
      Parameters:
      points - = list of geo point representing intersections points of the geometry
      Returns:
      the geo point that it's point value closest to the camera

    • findCLosestIntersection

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint findCLosestIntersection​(Ray ray)
      this function calculates the closest intersection of the object to the camera
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray constructed from the camera to the geometry
      Returns:
      the closest intersection point

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid​(int interval, java.awt.Color color)
      this function print the grid of the image
      Parameters:
      interval - = a parameter which symbolize the grid location
      color - =the color of the grid

    • writeToImage

      public void writeToImage()
      write the image
